description: Help the Scratch mascot avoid the space junk and return safely back to Earth!
name: space_junk

Click the 'Shrink' button and then click on the cat a few times to make it a little smaller.

To add a background, click 'Choose backdrop from library' and select the 'Stars' backdrop.

components.text: + Click 'Add new sprite from library' and add the 'Planet2' sprite to your stage. You can change the size of the planet if you want to.

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
	forever
		move (2) steps
		if on edge, bounce
	end
components.text: Add this code to make the planet move around the stage forever:

Click the green flag to test our your new planet. It should move left and right across the stage.

	Have you noticed that your planet turns upside-down (rotates) when it hits the edge of the screen? To fix this, just add this code to your planet sprite:

components.blocks:
if <touching [Cat1 v]?> then
		stop [all v]
	end

steps.description: Let's add some space junk for the cat to avoid.
steps.title: Space junk!

steps.description: Can you change the way your planet moves? You can use these blocks to help you, as well as any other blocks you like.
steps.title: Changing your planet's orbit

components.text: + Firstly, let's add the Earth sprite to the center of your stage.

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
	set size to (10) %
	forever
		change size by (0.3)
	end
components.text: Add this code to your Earth sprite, so that it starts off very small and slowly get's bigger and bigger:
Test out your Earth sprite. It should look as if your cat is slowly floating towards Earth!

Click on your stage, and create a new variable to store the time.

	You should now see your timer in the top-left of the stage.

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
	forever
		wait (0.1) secs
		change [time v] by (0.1)
	end
components.text: Add this code to your stage, so that the timer counts up forever:
Click the green flag and you should see your timer start to count up!

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
	set [time v] to [0]
	wait until <(time) > [30]>
	say [I made it!] for (2) secs
	stop [all v]
components.text:
The game is won if the cat can avoid the space junk for 30 seconds.

	For this to work, you just need to set your timer to 0 at the start of the game, and then wait until the timer gets to 30.
